name: Test 1: Overwhelm Pattern
title: Too Many Projects
content: I have 15 different projects going on right now and I can't focus on any single one. Everything feels urgent. My brain is racing between tasks - the Docker setup, the sentiment analysis workflow, updating documentation, fixing bugs in the API. I keep starting one thing, then remembering another thing I need to do, then jumping to that. Can't handle all of this at once. I'm drowning in tasks and don't know where to start. Everything at once is too much.

name: Test 2: Hyperfocus Pattern
title: Deep Dive Into Docker Networking
content: Been at this Docker networking issue for the past 6 hours straight. Lost track of time completely. Started at 2pm, looked up and it's 8pm already. I'm completely dialed in on this problem. The issue is with the bridge network configuration between n8n and Ollama containers. I've traced through the network stack, analyzed the DNS resolution, checked the host.docker.internal mapping, and I finally figured it out. The container startup order matters because the network bridge needs to be established before the API calls. I'm in the zone and don't want to stop now.

name: Test 3: Executive Dysfunction
title: Can't Get Started on Documentation
content: I know I need to write documentation for the sentiment analysis workflow. I've been thinking about it for three days now but I just can't get started. Every time I open the file, I freeze up. Should I start with the overview? Or maybe the technical details? Or the user guide? I don't know where to begin. All the options feel equally important and overwhelming. Maybe I'll do it tomorrow. Or maybe I should organize my notes first. But then I'd need to decide how to organize them. This is stuck. I'm procrastinating hard.

name: Test 4: Burnout Pattern
title: Exhausted and Unmotivated
content: I'm so tired. Been pushing hard for weeks and I just have no energy left. Even things I usually find exciting feel like a chore now. Just going through the motions with my work. The Selene project was supposed to be fun but right now I can't find the motivation to work on it. Everything feels heavy. I know I should care more but I'm burnt out. Need a break but feel guilty taking one because there's so much to do.

name: Test 5: Scattered/Distracted
title: Random Thoughts
content: Working on the sentiment workflow. Oh, I need to check if Ollama is running. Wait, did I respond to that email? Better do that now. Actually, first let me grab coffee. While I'm up, should reorganize my desk. Oh right, the workflow. What was I doing again? Something about sentiment. The emotional_tone field. But also I wonder if I should change the interval from 45 seconds to 30. Or maybe 60? Hard to focus today. Brain is all over the place jumping between ideas. Can't hold one thought long enough.

name: Test 6: Positive ADHD Traits
title: Creative Solution Found
content: Had a breakthrough moment today! I was working on the sentiment analysis and suddenly connected three different concepts that I didn't realize were related. The ADHD pattern detection could use the same approach as the theme extraction, but with emotional markers instead of topics. And this connects to how we could build a recommendation engine that suggests similar notes based on emotional state. My brain just made these rapid connections and now I see the whole architecture clearly. This is why I love building systems - when it clicks, it REALLY clicks. The pattern recognition ability and seeing connections others miss is such a strength.

name: Test 7: Calm and Productive
title: Good Progress Today
content: Had a really solid work session today. Made steady progress on the sentiment workflow enhancements. Added the new ADHD markers, updated the database schema, and wrote some tests. Everything flowed naturally without any major blocks. Feeling calm and focused. Not rushing, just working at a sustainable pace. It's nice when things feel manageable and I can check items off my list one by one. Good energy, not too high or too low.

name: Test 8: Mixed Emotions
title: Progress and Frustration
content: Making progress on the project which feels great, but also hitting some frustrating roadblocks. The sentiment analysis is working well for most cases, but the JSON parsing keeps failing on edge cases. I'm proud of what I've built so far, but annoyed that these little issues keep popping up. It's that mix of excitement about the potential and frustration with the current reality. Two steps forward, one step back. Overall moving in the right direction but wish it was smoother.
